DOC.brief_summary: This study develop/adapt culturally appropriate secondary prevention intervention young , Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) -positive woman intervention group , evaluate acceptability feasibility , make appropriate modification , manualize intervention preparation full-scale randomized trial . Once intervention developed/adapted , sit pilot intervention twice enable modification . The intervention aim address following concern : 1 ) reduce risk young woman infect HIV transmit virus sexual partner , 2 ) prevent young woman infect HIV re-infection new viral strain co-infection another sexually transmit disease ( STD ) . Data collect assess feasibility acceptability newly develop intervention use quantitative qualitative method iteration .
DOC.brief_title: Development Empowerment Intervention Young Women Living With HIV
DOC.criteria: Female birth currently female ; Receives service one select ATN sit community partner HIVinfected documented medical record review verbal verification refer professional Between age 1624 year ( inclusive ) time inform consent/assent Ability understand write spoken English Gives inform consent/assent study participation Presence active , serious psychiatric symptom ( e.g. , hallucination , think disorder ) would impair participant 's ability meet study requirement Visibly distraught ( e.g. , suicidal , homicidal , exhibit violent behavior ) Intoxicated influence alcohol substance time study enrollment* . Intoxication time visit exclude participation time . Participants visibly influence substance time enrollment consent . If participant return enroll sober , enrollment occur . Similarly , participant arrive intervention group visibly intoxicate , ask leave . However , prior intoxication eliminate future participation . Thus , dismissed session due intoxication return subsequent session long sober .
